Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code PA 116. 722.120
Title
Rule Code & 722.120 Investigation, inspection, and examination of
Section conditions, books, records, and reports; access by
Description department, bureau of fire services, or local authorities;
records; report; forms; confidentiality; disclosure of
information; availability of confidential records; child
information cards to be provided to department; failure of
licensee to cooperate with investigation, inspection, or
examination.
(c) Providing accurate and truthful information to the
department, and encouraging witnesses, such as staff and
household members, to provide accurate and truthful
information to the department.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that an agency staff falsified records.
Investigation The Quality Director was interviewed via telephone on
February 2, 2024. The Quality Director was informed of the
allegation. The Quality Director reported the agency Director of
Foster Care, had discovered that Staff 1, an agency foster care
worker, had documented she had visited a relative home when
she had not. The Quality Director reported Staff 1 had admitted
she did not visit the relative home but had telephoned the home
instead. The Quality Director reported it is documented that Staff 1
had visited the home. The Quality Director reported Staff 1’s
employment was terminated as a result of falsification of records.
The Director of Foster Care was interviewed via telephone on
February 9, 2024.
The Director of Foster Care reported Relative A had contacted the
agency Foster Care Supervisor to report Staff 1 had not visited
her home to complete a home study in anticipation of placement
of a relative child. The Director of Foster Care reported Staff 1 had
been directed to visit the home and complete the DHS-3130A so
placement of the child could occur. The Director of Foster Care
2

reported a MISACWIS contact dated December 22, 2023, entered
by Staff 1, indicates she had a face to face contact with Relative A
on that date. The Director of Foster Care reported Relative A had
informed the Foster Care Supervisor that Staff 1 had not visited
her home on December 22, 2023, or December 27, 2023. The
December 27, 2023, contact is documented in the DHS-3130A
dated January 2, 2024. The Director of Foster Care reported Staff
1 admitted she did not visit the home of Relative A but had instead
viewed the home virtually and Relative A assisted in this.
The Director of Foster Care reported Staff 1’s employment was
terminated due to falsification of records.
The Complainant was interviewed on February 9, 2024.
Relative A was interviewed via telephone on February 12,
2024. Relative A reported Staff 1 had never visited her home to
complete a home study. Relative A reported on December 27,
2023, a visit was scheduled but Staff 1 telephoned her and
cancelled. Relative A reported Staff 1 asked her to describe her
home during the phone call. Relative A further reported she never
signed any papers that would have been presented to her by Staff
1 during a home visit.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on March 4, 2024. Staff
1 reported she did not go to Relative A’s home on December 22,
2023. Staff 1 reported the documented contact for that day was a
“cut and paste” mistake and she did not visit the home on that
day. Staff 1 reported she did go to Relative A’s home on
December 27, 2023, and denied doing a virtual review of the
home.
The agency Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via
telephone on March 4, 2024. The Foster Care supervisor
reported she was the supervisor for Staff 1. The Foster Care
Supervisor reported Relative A had informed her that Staff 1 had
not been to her home at anytime to complete a home study. The
Foster Care Supervisor reported when confronted about home
visits not occurring, Staff 1 admitted she had not been to the home
on December 22nd or 27th, 2023.
The agency Human Resource Manager was interviewed on
March 4, 2024, via telephone. The Human Resource Manager
reported Staff 1’s employment was terminated on January 19,
2024, for reporting she had made in home contacts on December
22, 2023, and December 27, 2023, when the contacts did not
3

occur. The Human Resource Manager reported during the
severance meeting Staff 1 reported she had made a mistake
regarding the December 22, 2023, home visit and stated she
made a virtual visit of the home of Relative A on December 27,
2023.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
DHS 3130A Relative Home Study: A review of the home study
dated January 2, 2024, and completed by Staff 1, was conducted.
On page 7 of the home study it says in part, “The home has an
operable carbon monoxide detector and smoke detector.
These were viewed and operable on 12/27/2023.”
In MISACWIS there is not a corresponding documented visit
to the relative’s home on December 27, 2023. The visit to the
home is documented in the DHS-3130 A dated January 2, 2024,
but does not document whether this was a virtual or face to face
visit.
In MISACWIS there is an in home contact documented for
December 22, 2023.
Analysis The Quality Director, Director of Foster Care, and the Foster Care
Supervisor reported Staff 1 had admitted she did not visit Relative
A’s home as documented in the DHS-3130A and a contact note
dated December 22, 2023. The Human Resource Manager
reported Staff 1, during the severance meeting, only said she
made a mistake and had conducted a virtual inspection of the
home.
Relative A reported Staff 1 had not visited her home on December
22nd, or 27th, 2023. Relative A reported Staff 1 had asked her to
describe her home and a virtual viewing of the home did not
occur.
Staff 1 reported she did not go to Relative A’s home on December
22, 2023, and the contact was a cut and paste issue. Staff 1
reported a visit to the relative home on December 27, 2023, and
denied conducting a virtual visit.
The DHS-3130A documents a relative home visit on December
27, 2023, in which fire and carbon monoxide detectors were
installed and operable. There is not a corresponding social work
contact in MISACWIS documenting the visit occurred.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
